Post.title: git
Post._content:
```bash
$ git reset --hard HEAD^         
$ git reset --hard HEAD~3        3n
$ git reset --hard commit_id     / commitsha
```

```bash
$ git push origin HEAD --force
```

```bash
$ git reset --hard HEAD^
```

Post.title: linuxdockersentry
Post._content:
# 
## docker
apt-getwget
```bash
$ wget -qO- https://get.docker.com/ | sh
```
docker --version
## docker-compose
ComposeDocker
curlgithub**sudo -iroot**
```bash
curl -L https://github.com/docker/compose/releases/download/1.9.0/docker-compose-`uname -s`-`uname -m` > /usr/local/bin/docker-compose
chmod +x /usr/local/bin/docker-compose
```
`exit`root
`docker-compose --version`

# sentry
## sentry
githubsentry
```bash
git clone https://github.com/getsentry/onpremise.git
```
## sentry
: sentry
```bash
mkdir  -p data/{sentry,postgres}
```
: SENTRY_SECRET_KEYdockdocker-compose.yml
```bash
docker-compose run --rm web config generate-secret-key
```

```bash
docker-compose run --rm web upgrade
```

```bash
docker-compose up -d
```
9000sentry
{% asset_img 11.png  sentry %}

# 
 sentry.config.py

```bash
#email = env('SENTRY_EMAIL_HOST') or (env('SMTP_PORT_25_TCP_ADDR') and 'smtp')
#if email:
#    SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.backend'] = 'smtp'
#    SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.host'] = email
#    SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.password'] = env('SENTRY_EMAIL_PASSWORD') or ''
#    SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.username'] = env('SENTRY_EMAIL_USER') or ''
#    SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.port'] = int(env('SENTRY_EMAIL_PORT') or 25)
#    SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.use-tls'] = env('SENTRY_EMAIL_USE_TLS', False)

SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.backend'] = 'smtp'
SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.host'] = 'smtp.qq.com'
SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.password'] = '*******'
SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.username'] = 'sentry@**.com'
SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.port'] = 587
SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.use-tls'] = True
```

```bash
docker-compose down
docker-compose build 
make build 
docker-compose up -d  
```

# 
[linuxmac(sentry)](https://blog.csdn.net/itkingone/article/details/79005959)

title: linuxdockersentry
date: 2018-06-11 19:31:52
tags: [linux, docker, sentry]
---

# 
## docker
apt-getwget
```bash
$ wget -qO- https://get.docker.com/ | sh
```
docker --version
## docker-compose
ComposeDocker
curlgithub**sudo -iroot**
```bash
curl -L https://github.com/docker/compose/releases/download/1.9.0/docker-compose-`uname -s`-`uname -m` > /usr/local/bin/docker-compose
chmod +x /usr/local/bin/docker-compose
```
`exit`root
`docker-compose --version`

# sentry
## sentry
githubsentry
```bash
git clone https://github.com/getsentry/onpremise.git
```
## sentry
: sentry
```bash
mkdir  -p data/{sentry,postgres}
```
: SENTRY_SECRET_KEYdockdocker-compose.yml
```bash
docker-compose run --rm web config generate-secret-key
```

```bash
docker-compose run --rm web upgrade
```

```bash
docker-compose up -d
```
9000sentry
{% asset_img 11.png  sentry %}

# 
 sentry.config.py

```bash
#email = env('SENTRY_EMAIL_HOST') or (env('SMTP_PORT_25_TCP_ADDR') and 'smtp')
#if email:
#    SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.backend'] = 'smtp'
#    SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.host'] = email
#    SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.password'] = env('SENTRY_EMAIL_PASSWORD') or ''
#    SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.username'] = env('SENTRY_EMAIL_USER') or ''
#    SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.port'] = int(env('SENTRY_EMAIL_PORT') or 25)
#    SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.use-tls'] = env('SENTRY_EMAIL_USE_TLS', False)

SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.backend'] = 'smtp'
SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.host'] = 'smtp.qq.com'
SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.password'] = '*******'
SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.username'] = 'sentry@**.com'
SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.port'] = 587
SENTRY_OPTIONS['mail.use-tls'] = True
```

```bash
docker-compose down
docker-compose build 
make build 
docker-compose up -d  
```
